clues.text: Escaping Nazi domination in 1938, Sigmund Freud left his longtime Vienna home to settle in this capital
Freud & this Swiss mister met in 1907 & collaborated for 5 years before disagreeing & splitting up
In German, Freud called this part of the human psyche the "Uber-Ich"
Like father, like child--this offspring of Sigmund is considered a founder of child psychoanalysis
In mythology, he was the brother of Hypnos; in Freudian theory, it represents the death instinct

Bill Sikes
Esther Summerson
Dr. Alexandre Manette
Uriah Heep
To set a fair valuation of a property for a transaction, turn to a certified residential this professional
Cash, investments & physical goods are all these, from the Latin for "enough"
Colorful term for stock from an established company, regarded as a safe investment
Often used in mutual funds, it's the strategy of investing broadly across a number of investments to reduce risk
If you hold a bond as its price rises, this other 5-letter word falls, because you're getting a lower return percentage

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will begin with "E-X".)

clues.text: With the power of a million tornadoes, it's a description that overstates reality for effect
In math it indicates the number of times an expression is multiplied by itself
A concentrated substance used in chemistry or cooking
Like a foot or a hand, it's a part of something that is the farthest from the main part
Someone who deliberately behaves in an extravagant way to attract attention
Happy baby, in which you lie on your back with your knees to your chest & hold your feet, is a pose in this
He had a way with words, enumerating our unalienable rights as "Life, Liberty and the pursuit of Happiness"
The song "Happy" says, "Clap along if you feel like a room without" this
A book by him is called "Happiness Is a Warm Puppy"
In 1997 this French-named cosmetics company introduced Happy, a fragrance for women
Mount Kita-Dake, Japan's second-highest peak, is almost 2,000 feet lower than this top mountain
Some believe that Saudi Arabia's Jabal al-Lawz is the real this mountain Moses climbed
Rongbuk Monastery, at about 16,400 feet on this mountain in Tibet, is the world's highest religious temple
Declared a national park of this country in 1936 by Manuel Quezon, Mount Apo is home to a rare species of eagle
This mountain range's name means "kills the Hindu"; many Indian slaves died there while being moved to central Asia
Yes, Sir!  Among this British composer's awards & honors are 7 Tonys, 7 Oliviers & a life peerage
In 1911 this "King of Ragtime" completed "Treemonisha", an opera set during Reconstruction
This longtime conductor of the New York Philharmonic also composed the music for "West Side Story"
He composed "Peter and the Wolf" to demonstrate for children the instruments in an orchestra
He also wrote a "Death Valley Suite", but he's better known for his "Grand Canyon Suite"
...betook himself to Bethany & brought this old friend back to life
...walked on the water of this large local lake
...was celebrating this holiday at the Last Supper, so says Mark
...entered Jerusalem in triumph via this transport
...ascended into heaven from atop this peak 40 days after his resurrection

This daytime drama star had lost out on 18 straight Emmys, but it isn't going to be 19

This pop star won't try again to bring a monkey to Germany without immunization papers

The Raptors & the other Lakers are bystanders as he pours in 81 points & adds 2 assists

She & Justin Theroux have a wedding so secret, some guests arrive thinking it's just a house party

The "formal" type of this Latin word is the course of study; the "hidden" one is the social cues & values kids pick up

From the Latin for "parish", it's a primary or secondary school supported by a religious group

In 1907, in a slum in Rome, she set up her casa dei bambini, or "children's house"
At the daily Page 1 meeting, 1 decision is the prime spot, top right; on 7/14/15 it was this E.U. country's new austerity deal
In 2014 the Times got less legalistic & began using this word instead of terms like "harsh interrogation techniques"
The web feature "Watching", which began in 2014, gives running updates of news like this National Zoo arrival in Aug. 2015
The Times has covered same-sex marriages since 2002; weddings are in a section named for these solemn promises

rounds.text: A chain of volcanoes is named for this mountain range where the continental USA's deadliest eruption took place
